result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Wayne Wagganer

records.addlTxt: Order Binding DE over for Trial

Defendant Michael Wayne Wagganer in court, in custody.  Attorney Tim VerHoff in court for State of Wisconsin. 

DE states he did not qualify for SPD appointment, wishes to proceed without an attorney. Atty. VerHoff responds, gives request for setover due to witness availability. Court speaks to county appointment of counsel. DE requests time to speak to Atty. Jasti regarding appointment as counsel. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits, sets preliminary hearing for 11-3 at 8:30am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from ADA Helmberger requesting to reschedule the 10/20 PH

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JOS. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards people. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

2:08 PM Defendant Michael Wayne Wagganer in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Michael Wayne Wagganer.  Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
